title: Extract boot files from an ISO

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: The BIOS update for a Toshiba Satellite laptop is [here](http://cdgenp01.csd.toshiba.com/content/support/downloads/skvuv500.exe "External link"). When you run Launcher, it will create an ISO which is MBR and (I think) UEFI-bootable. I am trying to extract the FAT16 image which seems to be inside the 'boot' section of the ISO, but am unable to do it. I want to make a UEFI FAT32 image to add to Easy2Boot. If you boot the ISO using Easy2Boot in MBR mode, it boots to DOS and you can see an EFI\\BOOT folder with .EFI boot files and there are .EFI files present in the root. So it looks like it does contain UEFI boot files. Any ideas how to extract these files from the ISO? I have tried various utilities and nothing seems to work! Thanks, Steve

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Typical! Just after posting, I found a solution! [IsoBuster](http://www.isobuster.com/install.php "External link") extracted the .img file a treat!

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Check here:

[http://reboot.pro/to...-grub2-at-uefi/](http://reboot.pro/topic/20004-boot-a-acronis-true-image-2014-iso-image-with-grub2-at-uefi/ "")

and here:

[http://www.msfn.org/...-torito-images/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/172655-strange-or-odd-multi-or-single-boot-cddvd-el-torito-images/ "External link")

Isobuster should be able to see it, if it doesn't it would be nice to know, so that the Author will be able (hopefully) to add the feature.

Wonko
